Question: A small ice cube at a temperature of 0°C is dropped into a glass of water at 28°C and melts. What is the temperature of the water in the glass just after the ice cube melts?

Choices:
A: 0°C
B: between 0°C and 28°C
C: 28°C
D: greater than 28°C
steps: When the ice cube at 0°C is dropped into the water at 28°C, heat will transfer from the warmer water to the colder ice cube.
As the ice cube absorbs heat from the water, it will melt, and the temperature of the melted ice (now water) will remain at 0°C until all of the ice has melted.
After the ice has completely melted, the temperature of the mixture (the melted ice water and the remaining water) will depend on the heat exchange that occurred during the melting process.

Since there was an initial temperature difference, and some of the heat from the warmer water goes into melting the ice, the temperature of the water in the glass will drop from 28°C and rise from 0°C.

However, it will not reach 28°C immediately. Instead, the final temperature after the ice has melted will be somewhere between 0°C and 28°C as the heat from the water has now mixed with the melted ice.
